mods.abstract: RUNAWAY IN JAIL. WAS committed to the Jail of this parish, a runaway negro who calls his name JOE, and says he belongs to Robert Marshall, a negro trader of Glenn County Kentuckey, and he ran away from the Steamboat Ringgold. The said boy is about 22 years of age, and 5 feet 3 or 4 inches high, and has no visible marks. HENRY SULLIVAN, Jailor. Plaquemine, July 15th, 1848.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
